channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report E-2023120100
item.description:
Report E-2023120100

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: BALDWINSVILLE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer forklift operator hit a drum that was staged in the trailer with the freight he was removing consequently slightly puncturing the drum contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed in to a recovery container as was the damaged drum.

item.title: Report X-2023120472
item.description:
Report X-2023120472

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: CHEEKTOWAGA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver alerted Quality Assurance staff that a hazmat package seemed to be giving off a strong smell but there did not appear to be a leak of any kind. Package was brought to QA for inspection. No visible damage to the contents inside or to the outer box. No visible liquid stains on the box indicating any kind of leakage. Just a very strong smell of the contents. DescribePack: No visible holes or areas of the container appear to be leaking. Can was tipped in multiple positions to see if there was a leak spot. Found nothing. Just a strong smell from the metal can. Can was place in the box inside of 3 plastic bags. Padded absorbent was placed inside the bags to act as a wedge to hold the can in place. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was pulled from the van and dock area and taken to QA for inspection and then placed in the vented hazardous materials area.

item.title: Report X-2023120458
item.description:
Report X-2023120458

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being moved when an employee noticed damage to the package. Package was quickly brought to the hazmat cage and place in a drum before it could leak any further. DescribePack: The caps were completely loose, almost as if they weren't screwed on to begin with. They fell off when the bottles were lifted during inspection. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a hazmat drum as soon as the damage was noticed.

item.title: Report E-2023120093
item.description:
Report E-2023120093

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: ROCHESTER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XRC experienced a UN2922 Thiocare H101 71% release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-gallons of product released to a 16’ x 18.5’ area of the trailer floor due to a crack in the tote lid. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Spill-X-A was utilized to neutralize the impacted area. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all impacted rags and PPE into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023120117
item.description:
Report E-2023120117

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: SCHENECTADY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 11/08/2023, a Veolia employee from the Schenectady, NY office was unloading drums from a truck into another trailer at the Veolia, Schenectady, NY 10 day intransit facility when the employee noticed that a drum was leaking from the gasket of the lid of the 551A2 drum. The faulty gasket allowed for mineral oil to leak out of the drum. The mineral oil was used to coat the reactive lithium in the drum. No actual lithium was released from the drum. The 551A2 lid was opened and the gasket of the drum was inspected and found to be defective and had allowed mineral oil to seep out. The gasket on the drum was replaced and the entire drum was overpacked into an 85 gallon 1A2 salvage drum. Transportation to the ultimate disposal facility was continued.

item.title: Report E-2023120110
item.description:
Report E-2023120110

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: ROCHESTER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to a forklift accident, 2Gal AIC PH Equalizer (hazardous - UN1760) was released. The released product was contained and absorbed in the box and pallet. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released damaged jug and impacted box were placed into a 5 gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2023120071
item.description:
Report E-2023120071

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: JAMAICA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LUFTHANSA CARGO AKTIENGESELLSCHAFT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 2201 this evening we were contacted by Export Dock agent Jorge Lazo that LH6751S/29 ex PHL came in with a DG spill. When the truck was opened there was liquid already spilled and shutters were closed immediately. We immediately cordoned off the area and called PAPD to report the DG spill. PAPD Officer Farber (Badge#1829) responded at 2220 to investigate. PAPD ESU & Port Auth Ops arrived shortly after. Hassan simultaneously contacted the 24HR emergency contact on DGD (Celinia @ NCEC) and was advised safety precautions, spill response and containment methods. This was relayed to Port Ops and PAPD ESU. PAPD started containment process with speedy dry at 2235 and completed at 2320. 7 of 36 Jerricans (AWB 020-69236160) were affected and stored in containment drums in the DG reject area. AWB: 020-43064475 was loaded next to leaking jerricans and was also wet/stored in containment drum. We also noticed that liquid had leaked from trailer to tire and ground. Speedy dry was used to contain the leak. Safety-Kleen was contacted at 2323 for cleanup of contained spill and disposal. Safety-Kleen dispatched a response team at 0105 Trailer is currently in Bay 52. Driver is onsite waiting on cleanup to leave. IQSMS Report: 15387 PAPD Case: 23K302528 Truck number: 6751S/29NOV Driver name: Jose Deleon Provider: Forward Air Rcvd with Seal number 126350982 ex PHL. Shipment packed in non UN specification package.

item.title: Report X-2023120085

Report X-2023120085

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA found a wet corrosive box between doors 23 and 24 on the unload. QA quickly grabbed gloves and got a hazmat tote and bag and secured the leaking hazmat quickly and brought it to qa area to be processed further. DescribePack: the hazmat had a loose cap that leaked the contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: hazmat was put in the hazmat tote and brought to qa area

item.title: Report X-2023120016
item.description:
Report X-2023120016

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-17
  • City: WEST HENRIETTA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Packages were being unloaded off the trailers in the unload during the presort when one of the package handlers noticed that the box was leaking. He then informed the manager who got QA involved to begin the clean up process. DescribePack: Package seemed to leak due to improper packaging. There were 4 inner packages, 2 of which were secured in a second fibreboard box while the other two were not. Loose caps caused leakage within package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: In-house cleanup started immediately and we contained the package in a salvage drum.

item.description:

  • City: EAST SYRACUSE
  • State: NY

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED TO LEAKING CORROSIVE BOX IN FEEDER/P2 UNLOAD. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET TO CHECK FOR HAZARDS. USED PH PAPER AND SILVER SHIELD INNER LINERS ADDITIONALLY. USED SODIUM BICARBONATE AND ZEP ZORB TO CLEAN UP SPILL SITE AND TRANSPORT TO DAMAGE CAGE WITH LINED SPILL TRAY.

item.title: Report X-2023111267
item.description:
Report X-2023111267

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: ELMSFORD
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and punctured in damaged hazmat cage in terminal upon arrival. All 4 - 1 gallon bottles of Advantage Chemicals Oven & Grill Cleaner were removed and inspected. All caps were tightened and secured with 2 of the 4 bottles having a slightly less amount of solution than the other two. Liquid spillage and small punctures to the box can be seen on one side of the box. DescribePack: Internal and External partition corroded by inner liquid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was stood upright and brought over to Damage Hazmat cage for immediate inspection.
